Description: Body fragment of an Attic red-figured pottery calyx-krater; satyr to left, perhaps dancing, holding a large leaf-like object in right hand; before him, the hand of perhaps a maenad, painted white, holding a long torch.
Producer name: Attributed to: The Retorted Painter (attribution by Kreuzer)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Roemer and Pelizaeus Museum, Hildesheim. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1001)
Kreuzer 2011 / Griechische, ptolemäische und römische Keramik im Roemer- und Pelizaeus-Museum Hildesheim (p. 57 no. 51, pl. 34) (wrongly labelled 'Kat.-Nr. 50')
Exhibition history: Acquired by W. Pelizaeus in Egypt in 1913.
